page.title: 02Shrove Tuesday in Durweston
page.content: We be come a-shroven, For a piece of pancake, Or a piece of bacon, Or a little truckle cheese Of your own maken. So blow the fire, heat the pan, For we be come a-shroven. The children of Durweston First School go Shroving around the village on Shrove Tuesday singing this song. We go in two groups to all the houses, and people give us money which is shared out amongst the children. Mr Valentine Rickman is a man who died in 1925 and he wanted the children to keep up the tradition. My Dad went Shroving when he was at Durweston School. My Grandma gave all the children an orange each when they called at the village shop. It reminds the older people of when they were young and went Shroving themselves.
